metadata.title: CVE-2020-0444 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In audit_free_lsm_field of auditfilter.c, there is a possible bad kfree dueto a logic error in audit_data_to_entry. This could lead to localescalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-150693166References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-lowlatency - 5.4.0-18.22
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic-64k - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-lowlatency - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

No subscription required
